page.pageName: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Threat Landscape - Home

metaTags.metaDescription: The latest threat landscape content providing insights for the digital enterprise.

proactivePopup.subHeadingText: Learn how tech leaders are integrating AI into apps, securing complex networks, and more.

ctaButton.elementName: theNET - Tackling digital modernization: Leadership perspectives - Digital magazine - Button

relatedBlades.title: The API imperative: Safeguarding digital lifelines
relatedBlades.copy: APIs are central for how apps and websites work today — and as a result, they have become prime targets for attackers. Implementing strategies that address both current and emerging API threats can help enable more secure innovation.

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Threat Landscape - The API imperative: Safeguarding digital lifelines - Image

features.title: Cloud implications on business security
features.description: An upsurge in DDoS attacks, the expansion of hybrid work, and a rise in hacktivism related to geopolitical conflicts are forcing organizations to strengthen cloud security. Organizations should recalibrate strategies now to stay ahead

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Cloud implications on business security - Threat Landscape - Image

features.title: State of application security
features.description: Web applications are rarely built with security in mind. Yet, we use them daily for all sorts of critical functions, making them a rich target for hackers — here are 3 emerging trends requiring urgent attention from CISOs

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Threat Landscape - State of application security - Image

features.title: Securing the future: Cyber security readiness report
features.description: This 10-part series for CISOs looking to secure the future and achieve better outcomes for their organization breaks down survey results from over 4,000 cyber security professionals and uncovers new findings on security incidents and preparedness

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Threat Landscape - Securing the future: Cyber security readiness report - Image

features.title: Three emerging security trends
features.description: Security programs face constant expansion while tasked with protecting an evolving attack surface, especially as organizations rush to build and deploy internal AI models — Here are 3 emerging trends requiring immediate attention from CISOs

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Threat Landscape - Three emerging security trends - Image

features.title: Client-side attacks are mounting
features.description: Two new PCI compliance requirements aim to secure client-side environments and protect customers who are being exploited by supply chain attacks

features.title: Malware disguised as developer tools
features.description:
Attackers are finding more effective ways to infiltrate organizations, developer systems being the latest
target — three signs of common scams and the strategies to spot and stop them

features.title: Impersonation is fooling the enterprise

features.title: Three ways to stay ahead of new API threats
features.description: There are 200 million public and private APIs in use, and growing — to securely leverage their power, organizations need purpose-built API management

features.title: Are OSS attacks avoidable?
features.description: Open source software attacks are preventable, but not prevented — 4 tips to minimize OSS risk and reduce the likelihood of attack

features.description: Phishing is still the initial vector for 9 out of every 10 cyber attacks. Here are 3 key actions to strengthen any organization's security posture

features.title: The next era of DDoS attacks
features.description: The HTTP/2 'Rapid Reset' attack leaves the majority of web applications and servers vulnerable with over 62% of all Internet traffic using the HTTP/2 protocol

features.title: Phishing attacks leveraging legitimate services
features.description: Cybercriminals are stepping-up their game — no longer just impersonating brands but leveraging legitimate services from those brands to deliver their payload

features.title: The ripple effect of compromised credentials
features.description: 44% of employees use the same credentials for personal and work accounts — once exposed, the vulnerability is shared with their organization

features.title: Internet trends report: Deep dive into the latest cyber threats
